intro: Otiophora inyangana subsp. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The subspecies is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. This plant is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions.
